project.teaser: BROAD-ER aims at building a Research Excellence Network which will foster interdisciplinary research and education at the nexus of migration and urban studies. The complementary knowledge, skills, and expertise of two top-class universities, UvA and UPF will be leveraged...
project.objective: BROAD-ER aims at building a Research Excellence Network which will foster interdisciplinary research and education at the nexus of migration and urban studies. The complementary knowledge, skills, and expertise of two top-class universities, UvA and UPF will be leveraged alongside their structured institutional capacity, to turn KU’s weaknesses into strengths. BROAD-ER will reinforce MiReKoc, leading Turkish institution in the migration field, position and develop its scientific, technological, and development-driven management capacities. The collaboration of these 3 universities aims at closing the research gap within the ERA by establishing innovative and interdisciplinary approaches while also increasing Research & Innovation capacities in Turkey in pivotal emergent fields namely migration and urban studies. BROAD-ER aspires for KU to become an important regional Centre of Excellence for South-Eastern Europe and enhance its collaboration with ERA countries. It will achieve these objectives through diverse activities focusing on research knowledge transfer, enhancing KU’s research capacity and a developing a comprehensive sustainability strategy. BROAD-ER will offer scientific and research management training activities to researchers including research proposal management, key transferable skills (ethical issues, diversity, equity and inclusion, scientific outreach, entrepreneurship, technology transfer, etc.) while addressing research excellence in the project’s fields. The training plans will be complemented with mobility activities allowing the establishment of networking structures and increasing KU’s internationalization. BROAD-ER will result in multiple (joint) publications in high impact top-tier journals, an increased capacity to attract research funding and undertake proposal management and an updated open and transparent recruitment process for researchers.
project.title: Bridging the Migration and Urban Studies Nexus
project.keywords: research excellence, mobility, capacity-building, migration, cities, urban politics

result.title: Conceptual Papers prepared by each partner on different themes
result.description: Each partner will review the literature of the processes of autonomy-building they have been assigned to, concerning the decoupling of cities from their national governments: Internationalization of Cities (KU); Establishing New Relations between the National and the Local and Increasing autonomy from national government (UPF); Detachment from Formal Governance by Independent Actors (UvA). (D5.1, M6)

result.title: Preliminary report synthesizing the literature and the fieldwork on urban politics and autonomy-building processes of the cities
result.description: Based on the D5.4 Preliminary Report Synthesizing the Literature and the Fieldwork on Urban Politics and Autonomy-building Processes of the Cities (ALL) (M14), a research agenda will be determined for the production of research outputs.

result.title: De-bordering policies at the city scale: strategies for building resilience in Barcelona's migration governance
Editorial: Resilient cities and migration governance: when developing migration governance capacity becomes a policy priority for cities
Local Turn Through International Networking: Istanbul's Migration City Diplomacy
Reports of the fieldwork
result.description: After the determination of the research agenda through the state-of-the-art report and above-mentioned workshop, each partner will establish a small group of researchers within their institutions, to interview with, and collect data from the key persons including policy makers, practitioners, international organisation and NGO representatives in their corresponding cities.

result.title: State-of-the-art report on urban politics and autonomy-building processes of the cities
result.description: The research agenda will be determined through the state-of-the-art report.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
